definition: snow/snowfall/CL:場|场[chang2]/to have the appearance of snow/to wipe away, off or out/to clean
phonetic character used in loanwords for the sound "jia", although 夹 is more common
cigarette lighter plug (inserted in a car's cigarette lighter socket to draw power)

sentences.english: The man struck a match and lit his cigar.
sentences.chinese: 那人划了根火柴点燃雪茄。

sentences.english: He flicked the ashes from his cigar.
The aroma is a complex mix of blackcurrant with liquor ice and violets with hints of a cigar box.
sentences.chinese: 香气是一种混合黑醋栗带有紫罗兰和雪茄盒子的感觉。

sentences.english: On the day of the birth of his first child, he was giving cigars away to all and sundry.
sentences.chinese: 他第一个孩子出生的那天，他向所有的人都敬雪茄烟。

sentences.english: My father allows himself only three cigars a day.
sentences.chinese: 我爸爸给自己规定一天只抽三支雪茄烟。

sentences.english: An exploding cigar was reportedly one of the plans.
sentences.chinese: 据说计划之一是一支会爆炸的雪茄。

sentences.english: For example, the best of Mike Du cigars are pure handmade.
sentences.chinese: 例如，极品的麦克纽杜雪茄都是纯手工制作。

sentences.english: Her audience chewed on its cigars.
sentences.chinese: 她的观众兀自嚼着口中的雪茄。

sentences.english: He bought a cigar holder for his father yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 我爸爸给自己规定一天只抽三支雪茄烟。

sentences.english: Have you ever smoked a cigar?
Yes, I have smoked a cigar.
He was a big man with a cigar and a camel's-hair coat.
sentences.chinese: 那是一个抽着雪茄，穿着驼毛大衣，体形硕大的男人。

sentences.english: He likes to smoke mild cigars.
I smoke old stogies I have found.
sentences.chinese: 我抽我找到的廉价雪茄。

definition: cigarette lighter plug (inserted in a car's cigarette lighter socket to draw power)
cigarette or pipe tobacco/CL:根[gen1]/smoke/mist/vapour/CL:縷|缕[lu:3]/tobacco plant/(of the eyes) to be irritated by smoke
